message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.MM 

This paper proposes a new approach for temporal action detection using reinforcement learning and deep Q-learning algorithm. The proposed method involves active action proposal model that learns to find actions through continuously adjusting the temporal bounds in a self-adaptive way. This approach is related to computer vision (cs.CV) as it deals with video analysis and action detection. It also involves machine learning (cs.AI) and reinforcement learning (cs.LG) as it uses deep Q-learning algorithm to learn the agent's decision policy. Additionally, it involves robotics (cs.RO) as it uses an agent to perform the action detection task. Finally, it also relates to multimedia (cs.MM) as it deals with video analysis and feature extraction.
